meanings.definition: Infection caused by the transmission of a pathogen from one part of the body to another part of the same body.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that autoinfection can occur when a virus spreads within the body.
meanings.sent2: After the surgery, there was a risk of autoinfection if proper care was not taken.
meanings.sent3: Tom joked that his cold seemed to enjoy autoinfection and was moving around his body like a tourist.
meanings.sent4: The concept of autoinfection is like a sneaky spy, silently moving from one body area to another.
meanings.sent5: The textbook vividly described autoinfection as a stealthy intruder within the body.

meanings.definition: The process by which an individual becomes infected with a pathogen that they already harbor.
meanings.sent1: Autoinfection can be dangerous as it means the body is fighting against itself.
meanings.sent2: The doctor warned about the possibility of autoinfection if the immune system weakened.
meanings.sent3: The idea of autoinfection sounded like a strange game of tag within the body.
meanings.sent4: Autoinfection is like a double agent, causing harm from within.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed autoinfection as a hidden enemy waiting to strike.
